item.title: Leah add a quote by Mark Helprin
item.description: "Words were all he knew; they possessed and overwhelmed him, as if they were a thousand white cats with whom he shared a one-room apartment." -- Mark Helprin

item.title: Leah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Everything was beautiful and nothing hurt." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "True terror is to wake up one morning and discover that your high school class is running the country." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leah add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "You don't need a weatherman to know which way the wind blows." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Leah add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description:
"I was so much older then; I'm younger than that now.
From the back pages" -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Leah add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "Avant-garde is French for bullshit" -- John Lennon

item.title: Leah add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "For a very long time everybody refuses and then almost without a pause almost everybody accepts." -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Leah add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "As it has been said: Love and a cough cannot be concealed. Even a small cough. Even a small love." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Leah add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "God owns heaven but He craves the earth." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Leah add a quote by Pete Seeger
item.description: "Participation - that's what's gonna save the human race." -- Pete Seeger

item.title: Leah add a quote by Howard Zinn
item.description: "Let us in the name of the Holy Trinity go on sending all the slaves that can be sold." -- Howard Zinn

item.title: Leah add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "We shouldn't be looking for heroes, we should be looking for good ideas." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Leah add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "That is what I have always understood to be the essence of anarchism: the conviction that the burden of proof has to be placed on authority, and that it should be dismantled if that burden cannot be met." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Leah add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "...the Bible is probably the most genocidal book in the literary canon." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Leah add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I talk to God but the sky is empty." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Leah add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "The animals of the world exist for their own reasons. They were not made for humans any more than black people were made for white, or women created for men." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Leah add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "There are years that ask questions and years that answer." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Leah add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Don't let the bastards grind you down." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Leah add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Leah add a quote by Dolen Perkins-Valdez
item.description: "My children ain’t the only thing I love. If I was allowed, I reckon I’d love myself, too." -- Dolen Perkins-Valdez

item.title: Leah add a quote by Judith Lewis Herman
item.description: "Combat and rape, the public and private forms of organized social violence, are primarily experiences of adolescent and early adult life. The United States Army enlists young men at seventeen; the average age of the Vietnam combat soldier was nineteen. In many other countries boys are conscripted for military service while barely in their teens. Similarly, the period of highest risk for rape is in late adolescence. Half of all victims are aged twenty or younger at the time they are raped; three-quarters are between the ages of thirteen and twenty-six. The period of greatest psychological vulnerability is also in reality the period of greatest traumatic exposure, for both young men and young women. Rape and combat might thus be considered complementary social rites of initiation into the coercive violence at the foundation of adult society. They are the paradigmatic forms of trauma for women and men." -- Judith Lewis Herman

item.title: Leah add a quote by Judith Lewis Herman
item.description: "The legal system is designed to protect men from the superior power of the state but not to protect women or children from the superior power of men. It therefore provides strong guarantees for the rights of the accused but essentially no guarantees for the rights of the victim. If one set out by design to devise a system for provoking intrusive post-traumatic symptoms, one could not do better than a court of law." -- Judith Lewis Herman
